DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether there is a significant decrease in cerebral oxygen saturation in hypertensive patients undergoing major abdominal surgery and their correlation with standard monitoring parameters.
DOC.brief_title: Monitoring Hypertensive Patients's Cerebral Oxygen Saturation
DOC.criteria: patients have hypertension more than 3 year,whether wellcontrolled or uncontrolled, scheduled for major abdominal surgery for at least 2 h under general anesthesia American Society of Anesthesiologists（ASA）physical status : II ~ III Age ＞ 30 preexisting cerebral pathology for example episodes of cerebral ischemia or stroke; ASA physical status ＞IV hepatic failure renal failure preoperative MiniMental State Examination (MMSE) score less than 24 a history of cardiovascular surgery or craniotomy cardiac failure respiratory failure
